Plain english: If I had a nickel for every time I saw someone as cute as you, I’d have five cents
shakespear: Alas, if mine purse held a nickel for every time mine eyes beheld one as fair as thee, I would possess a sum of five cents.

Plain english: Are you my laptop? Because you’re really hot, and I’m concerned.
shakespear: Pray, art thou my laptop? For thou art hot as the fires of Hades, and I fear for thy well-being.

Plain english: Could you possibly get me a glass of water? I’m suddenly really thirsty.
shakespear: Might I request a glass of water, fair maiden? For suddenly, my throat doth grow parched.

Plain english: Look, I’ve been blinded by your beauty. My insurance company is going to need your name and number.
shakespear: Behold, thy beauty hath blinded mine eyes! Pray, thy name and number for the sake of mine insurance.

Plain english: Your eyes are like Ikea. I’m totally lost in them.
shakespear: Thine eyes are like unto the labyrinth of Ikea; I am utterly lost within them.

Plain english: Are you my untied shoelace? Because I’m falling for you.
shakespear: Art thou perchance mine untied shoelace? For verily, I feel myself falling for thee.

Plain english: I think I’ve seen you in a book somewhere. it was really fine print.
shakespear: Methinks I have seen thee in a volume of fine print.

Plain english: I want you to know that I am 100% committed to this Tinder relationship.
shakespear: Pray, know that I am devoted wholly to this Tinder courtship.

Plain english: Be honest: Is this match at first sight for you too?
shakespear: Pray, be honest with me: was it love at first sight for thee as well?

Plain english: Are you French? Because Eiffel for you.
shakespear: Art thou French, perchance? For I am falling for thee like the Eiffel Tower.

Plain english: You must be terrible at hide and seek. Someone like you is so hard to find!
shakespear: Methinks thou would make a poor player of hide-and-seek, for one as lovely as thee would be hard to find indeed!

Plain english: Look, I won’t flirt with you. I’ll just be extra friendly to someone who is extra attractive.
shakespear: I shall not flirt with thee, fair maiden; rather, I shall be extra friendly towards one as comely as thee.

Plain english: If you were a fruit, you’d be a fineapple.
shakespear: If thou wert a fruit, thou wouldst be a fineapple.

Plain english: Do you like bagels? Because you’re bae goals.
shakespear: Pray, dost thou enjoy bagels? For thou art truly bae goals.

Plain english: Do you know what I have in common with the Little Mermaid? We both want to be part of your world.
shakespear: Dost thou know what I have in common with the Little Mermaid? We both desire to be a part of thy world.

Plain english: Are you from space? Because you’re out-of-this-world good-looking.
shakespear: Art thou from the stars, perchance? For thou art out of this world fair.

Plain english: If you were a vegetable, you’d be a cute-cumber.
shakespear: If thou wert a vegetable, thou wouldst be a cute-cumber.

Plain english: Do you ever wear fishnet stockings? Because you’re a real catch.
shakespear: Dost thou ever don fishnet stockings? For thou art a real catch.

Plain english: Roses are red. Violets are blue. How did I get so lucky to match with you?
shakespear: Roses are red, violets are blue; how lucky am I to have matched with one as fair as you?

Plain english: If you were a taser, you’d be set to stun.
shakespear: If thou wert a taser, thou wouldst surely be set to stun.

Plain english: Do you play soccer? You look like a keeper.
shakespear: Pray, dost thou play soccer? For thou lookest like a keeper.

Plain english: Are you a gardener? I like your tulips.
shakespear: Art thou a gardener? For I find myself enamoured with thy tulips.

Plain english: How much does a polar bear weigh? Enough to break the ice!
shakespear: How much doth a polar bear weigh? Enough to break the ice, methinks!

Plain english: Did you fall into a pile of sugar? You’re looking super sweet.
shakespear: Dost thou possess a sweetness akin to that of sugar? For thou art looking super sweet.

Plain english: Do you like cheese? Would you like to brie with me?
shakespear: Dost thou enjoy cheese? Wouldst thou care to brie with me?

Plain english: Just wanted to let you know: You have some cute on your face.
shakespear: I simply wished to inform thee that thou hast some cute upon thy visage.

Plain english: Are your parents bakers? They sure made a cutie-pie.
shakespear: Pray, were thy parents bakers? For they have surely made a cutie-pie.

Plain english: Do you have an Instagram account? Because my mother always told me to follow my dreams…
shakespear: Dost thou possess an Instagram account? For my mother didst always advise me to follow my dreams...

Plain english: I think I saw you on Spotify. You were listed as the hottest single.
shakespear: Methinks I saw thee upon Spotify, listed as the hottest single.

Plain english: bet I know when your birthday is: Oct. 10. Because you’re a 10/10
shakespear: I wager I know thy birthday: October the tenth, for thou art a 10/10.

Plain english: Is your Bluetooth enabled? I feel like we could pair.
shakespear: Art thou enabled with Bluetooth? For I feel that we might be paired together.

Plain english: I hope you know CPR because you’re taking my breath away.
shakespear: I do hope thou knowest CPR, for thou art stealing away mine breath.

Plain english: Have you been speeding? Because you’ve got “fine” written all over you.
shakespear: Hast thou been speeding? For thou hast the word "fine" written all over thee.

Plain english: I need a real estate agent—do you know any? I’m trying to make a move here.
shakespear: Pray, might thou recommend a real estate agent? For I am looking to make a move here.

Plain english: All your pics came through at a 45-degree angle. Guess you’re acute-y.
shakespear: All of thy pictures have come through at a 45-degree angle. Methinks thou art quite acute-y.

Plain english: Are you HTTP? Because without you I’m just ://
shakespear: Oh, fair maiden, dost thou see a rainbow outside? For I believe I have discovered gold in thy presence.

Plain english: Is there a rainbow outside? I think I just found gold.
shakespear: Pray tell, dost thou know the square root of two? For when I am near thee, I feel a most irrational fervor.

Plain english: Do you know the square root of two? Because I feel irrational around you.
shakespear: Thou art like a small amount of red phosphorus, and I a tiny wooden stick - together, we are a match made in heaven.

Plain english: You must be a small amount of red phosphorus, and I must be a tiny wooden stick—we’re a match.
shakespear: Good sir, I am composing an article on life's finer things, and I would be most honored to interview thee.

Plain english: Hey, I’m writing an article on the finer things in life, and I was hoping I could interview you.
shakespear: I would ask thee to accompany me to the cinema, but alas, they forbid the bringing of one's own refreshments.

Plain english: I would ask you to come to the movies with me, but they have a rule against bringing your own snacks.
shakespear: I have recently acquired a lipstick impervious to kisses, and I am eager to put it to the test.

Plain english: I just bought a kiss-proof lipstick, and I want to test it out.
shakespear: I have recently acquired a lipstick impervious to kisses, and I am eager to put it to the test.

Plain english: On a scale of one to 10, I’m a nine. But you’re the one I need.
shakespear: On a scale of one to ten, I consider myself a nine. But thou art the one I require.

Plain english: I guess the pandemic is far from over because your smile is contagious.
shakespear: Verily, the pandemic is far from over, for thy smile is as contagious as any malady.

Plain english: Are you a good cuddler? Because if so, I might let you join my gang.
shakespear: Art thou a proficient cuddler? For if so, thou art most welcome to join my clan.

Plain english: Do you believe in love at first sight, or shall I delete this match and try again?
shakespear: Dost thou believe in love at first sight, or shall I erase this match and try again?

Plain english: If you could be any comic book character, who would you be?
shakespear: If thou couldst assume the guise of any comic book hero, who wouldst thou choose?

Plain english: Are you my oven? Because you’re hot, and I want you to make me dinner.
shakespear: Art thou my oven? For thou art hot, and I yearn for thee to cook me a meal.

Plain english: You look so familiar! Did we have chemistry together?
shakespear: Thou seemest most familiar! Did we perhaps share a chemistry class?

Plain english: Let’s just set an anniversary date right now.
shakespear: Let us establish an anniversary this very moment.

Plain english: Just call me Shrek because I’m head ogre heels for you.
shakespear: Call me Shrek, for I am head ogre heels for thee.

Plain english: Are you my lost luggage? Because I’ve been having so much trouble finding you.
shakespear: Art thou my lost luggage? For I have been searching tirelessly for thee.

Plain english: You’re so gorgeous, I forgot my best pickup line.
shakespear: Hast thou recently visited a physician? For I believe thou art lacking in vitamin me.

Plain english: Have you been to the doctor recently? I think you’re lacking some vitamin me.
shakespear: Thou art lovely, and I am charming. Together, we could be positively enchanting!

Plain english: You’re pretty, and I’m cute. Together we could be pretty cute!
shakespear: In truth, I am not so tall - I am merely perched upon my wallet.

Plain english: I’m not really this tall. I’m just sitting on my wallet.
shakespear: Dost thou know what is on the menu tonight? Me-n-U.

Plain english: Do you know what’s on the menu tonight? Me-n-U.
shakespear: I have recently become an organ donor, for I would bestow upon thee my heart.

Plain english: I just became an organ donor so I could give you my heart.
shakespear: Excuse me, wouldst thou kindly tie thy shoes? For I would not have thee fall for another.

Plain english: Hey! Tie your shoes…I don’t want you falling for anyone else.
shakespear: Prithee, might thou direct me to the location of thy heart? For I am lost, and thou art the only guide I seek.

Plain english: Excuse me…I’m a bit lost. Can you give me directions to your heart?
shakespear: If purloining men's hearts were a crime, thou wouldst be condemned to a lifetime sentence.

Plain english: You know…if stealing men’s hearts was a crime, you’d be sentenced to life.
shakespear: Art thou a magician? For when I gaze upon thee, all others vanish from sight.

Plain english: Are you a magician? Because whenever I look at you, everyone else disappears.
shakespear: Hail, fair lady! I am [insert name], thine appointed date for the eve, courtesy of the management.

Plain english: Hi, I’m [insert name]. I’m your assigned date for the night, compliments of the management.
shakespear: Forgive me, but it is hard to believe that one as exquisite as thee is present on this app.

Plain english: Excuse me, I find it hard to believe that someone as beautiful as you is on this app.
shakespear: Prithee, might thou pinch me? For I cannot fathom that thou art real - I thought I was but dreaming.

Plain english: Can you pinch me? [Why] Because I can’t believe you’re real…I thought I was dreaming.
shakespear: Rejoice, for this is a fortunate day, as I happen to be single.

Plain english: This is your lucky day because I just happen to be single.
shakespear: Last night, I dreamt of thee. Wouldst thou consider making it a reality?

Plain english: I had a dream about you last night. Would you like to make it a reality?
shakespear: My dearest, thou must be a broom, for thou hast swept me off my feet.

Plain english: Baby, you must be a broom, cuz you just swept me off my feet.
shakespear: Greetings, the voices within my head have instructed me to come hither and speak with thee.

Plain english: Hi, the voices in my head told me to come over and talk to you.
shakespear: If thou wert a vegetable, thou wouldst be a cutecumber.

Plain english: If you were a vegetable, you’d be a cutecumber.
shakespear: Art thy father an alien? For thou art otherworldly in thy beauty.

Plain english: Is your dad an alien? Because you are out of this world.
shakespear: Alas, I possess no library card - might I peruse thy pages instead?

Plain english: I don’t have a library card, but do you mind if I check you out?
shakespear: Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?

Plain english: Do you have a twin sister? Because you look like the girl of my dreams.
shakespear: Thou art like my heart's sweet twin sister, fair and lovely.

Plain english: Are you a wifi signal? Because I’m really feeling a strong connection.
shakespear: Art thou a wondrous Wi-Fi signal, for I do feel a strong and steady connection between us.

Plain english: Excuse me, do you have a name? I need it for my prayers tonight.
shakespear: Prithee, might I know thy name, for it doth belong in my prayers this eve?

Plain english: Do you have a map? Because I just got lost in your eyes.
shakespear: Hast thou a map? Forsooth, mine eyes have lost their way in thy bewitching gaze.

Plain english: Are you a time traveler? Because I can’t imagine my future without you.
shakespear: Art thou a traveler of time? For without thee, I cannot envision my future.

Plain english: Do you know what my shirt is made of? Boyfriend/girlfriend material.
shakespear: Dost thou know of what my shirt is made? It is of a material suitable for a lover, such as thyself.

Plain english: Are you a camera? Because every time I look at you, I smile.
shakespear: Art thou a camera? For each time I look upon thy countenance, my heart doth smile.

Plain english: If you were a fruit, you'd be a fineapple.
shakespear: If thou wert a fruit, thou wouldst be a fine apple indeed.

Plain english: Do you know what my shirt is made of? Husband/wife material.
shakespear: Knowest thou of what my shirt is made? It is of a material befitting a spouse, like unto thyself.

Plain english: Do you have a Band-Aid? I just scraped my knee falling for you.
shakespear: Hast thou a Band-Aid, for I have scraped my knee, falling head over heels for thee.

Plain english: I’m not a genie, but I can make your dreams come true.
shakespear: I am no genie, yet I shall make thy dreams come true, my love.

Plain english: Do you have a map? Because I keep getting lost in your eyes.
shakespear: Hast thou a map, for mine eyes continue to lose their way in thy enchanting gaze.

Plain english: Is your dad a baker? Because you're a cutie pie!
shakespear: Is thy father a baker? For thou art a cutie pie.

Plain english: If you were a vegetable, you’d be a cute-cumber.
shakespear: If thou wert a vegetable, thou wouldst be a cute-cumber indeed.

Plain english: Do you know what I'm thinking? I'm thinking we should hang out.
shakespear: Dost thou know what I am thinking? I am thinking that we should spend time together.

Plain english: Are you a magician? Because whenever I look at you, everyone else disappears.
shakespear: Art thou a magician? For every time I gaze upon thee, all others do vanish from my sight.

Plain english: Can I follow you where you go? Because my parents always told me to follow my dreams.
shakespear: May I follow thee wherever thou goest, for my parents didst always tell me to pursue my dreams.

Plain english: Are you a mermaid? Because I’m drowning in your beauty.
shakespear: Art thou a mermaid? For I feel myself drowning in thy beauty.

Plain english: Do you know what my shirt is made of? Boyfriend material.
shakespear: Knowest thou of what my shirt is made? It is of a material befitting a lover, like unto thyself.

Plain english: Are you a parking ticket? Because you’ve got "fine" written all over you.
shakespear: Art thou a parking ticket? For thou art truly "fine" in every sense of the word.

Plain english: I’m not a photographer, but I can picture us together.
shakespear: I am no photographer, yet I can envision us together as a pair.

Plain english: Do you have a twin sister? Because you look like the girl of my dreams.
shakespear: Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?

Plain english: Is your name Google? Because you have everything I’ve been searching for.
shakespear: Is thy name Google? For thou dost possess all that I have sought and searched for.

Plain english: Do you have a Band-Aid? I just scraped my knee falling for you.
shakespear: Hast thou a Band-Aid, for I have scraped my knee, falling head over heels for thee.

Plain english: Do you have a name or can I call you mine?
shakespear: Might I know thy name, or shall I have the honor of calling thee mine own?

Plain english: Do you have a map? I just got lost in your eyes.
shakespear: Hast thou a map, for I find myself lost in the depths of thy captivating gaze.

Plain english: Are you a library book? Because I can't stop checking you out.
shakespear: Art thou a library book? For I cannot resist checking thee out.
